name: Asian Mushroom Soup
author: USA WEEKEND columnist Jean Carper
summary: Assorted mushrooms, vegetables, chicken, and noodles mingle well in this hearty and healthy soup.
ingredients: 3 cups assorted mushrooms, sliced (I like white buttons, oyster, shiitake, portobello and crimini
3 cups white cabbage, cut in wedges
2 cups fresh udon noodles (or substitute cooked linguine)
1 cup thinly sliced green onions, with some of the green tops
2 cups shredded raw spinach or whole baby spinach leaves
Freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: In a large pot, combine broth, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, mushrooms, cabbage, carrots and chicken
Bring to a boil; simmer until mushrooms are soft, about 5 minutes
Stir in noodles, green onions and spinach; simmer until greens are wilted, about 2 minutes
